titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to "The history of Western medicine" video recording, 1997 RL.11345
titlestmt.author: Paula Jeannet

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-11-01 16:15:07 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: The history of Western medicine video recording

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of South Carolina. School of Library and Information Science

did.abstract: Educational video on the history of Western medicine presented by the University of South Carolina's College of Library and Information Science as part of a workshop created by the library school specifically for students and professionals interested in medical history. Dr. Daniel Barron, USC Library School faculty, moderates a discussion with Lucretia McClure, Medical Library Special Collections, Harvard, and Dr. John Erlen, professor of History at the University of Pittsburgh, on issues in the study of the history of medicine. Interspersed with their comments are video segments that provide an overview of the evolution of Western medical knowledge and practices from Neolithic times to the 20th century. Acquired as part of the History of Medicine Collections at Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original media is closed to use. A viewing copy must be made for access.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: "The history of Western medicine" video recording was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], "The history of Western medicine" video recording, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Educational video on the history of Western medicine presented by the University of South Carolina's College of Library and Information Science as part of a workshop created by the library school specifically for students and professionals interested in medical history. Dr. Daniel Barron, USC Library School faculty, moderates a discussion with Lucretia McClure, Medical Library Special Collections, Harvard, and Dr. John Erlen, professor of History at the University of Pittsburgh, on issues in the study of the history of medicine. Interspersed with their comments are video segments that provide an overview of the evolution of Western medical knowledge and practices from Neolithic times to the 20th century. Acquired as part of the History of Medicine Collections at Duke University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jonathon Erlen is a history of medicine librarian at the Falkland Library of Health Sciences, University of Pittsburgh.

unittitle.label: Collection
unittitle.extref: "A brief history of medicine" short subject film, circa 1969

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Video cassette, 1/2 inch tape. TRT (total running time) approximately 00:30:00 (30 minutes); VHS format.
